text: One of my favorite speakers and presenters on games and gaming did this awesome piece about her experiences with the awesome game "Assassin". <http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/222713/Watergun_assassin_The_grand_game_story_of_Street_Wars.php>

attachments.title: Watergun assassin: The grand game story of Street Wars
attachments.text: Leigh Alexander shares her harrowing story of Street Wars, a live, three-week watergun assassination game recently in London -- and what she learned about the delusions games give us about ourselves.
attachments.fallback: Watergun assassin: The grand game story of Street Wars

text: Also, I hate trolling lawsuits, but this one is interesting: Can a graphics technique used to simulate higher resolutions really be 'native'? And how does a wording mishap like this effect marketing for games in years to come? <http://www.polygon.com/2014/8/6/5975983/sony-sued-killzone-shadow-fall-1080p>

attachments.title: Sony sued over Killzone: Shadow Fall's graphics
attachments.text: Sony Computer Entertainment America has been hit with a lawsuit alleging
attachments.fallback: Polygon: Sony sued over Killzone: Shadow Fall's graphics
